title: Zuccardi 2017 Fosil San Pablo Chardonnay (Uco Valley)
description: Few Argentinean Chardonnays have achieved this level of quality, so despite the high price, Fosil is special. For starters, it comes from the spot with the highest elevation in Mendoza: San Pablo in the Uco Valley. This smells of spiced apple and butterscotch, while a high-energy palate comes straight from the terroir. Lightly buttery baked apple and peach flavors are pure and steady on a firm, balanced finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Acumen 2014 Peak Attelas Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From an estate-grown site that's rocky and sheltered from high heat, this wine, blended with 4% Malbec, retains plenty of firm acidity alongside big-boned tannins and balanced weight. Coffee and cassis complement a wealth of dark cherry, blueberry and plum flavors.

title: Allan Hancock 2016 Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Dark berry and cherry fruits meet with turned earth, oak smoke and wet rocks on the intriguing nose of this bottling from the Santa Maria community college winery. Boysenberry and black-raspberry flavors show on the sip alongside shaved cocoa and soil flavors, the overall richness cut smartly by acid.

title: Balletto 2016 BCD Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Bright and balanced, this is from a relatively warm site and is full, fleshy and meaty in style. Savory black tea and cardamom season a core of red cassis, black cherry and strawberry, with a soft, velvety texture behind the fruit.
designation: BCD Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Barfontarc 2009 Cuvée Sainte Germaine Brut  (Champagne)
description: Produced by the Baroville cooperative in the Aube, this rich, rounded wine has balanced fruit that is just beginning to show some good aging. Toast and almonds are coming through the tight white-fruit texture. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Baron Albert NV La Pimpante Blanc de Blancs Fûts Brut  (Champagne)
description: Fermented in wood, this is a rich, concentrated wine. A panoply of ripe white fruits and tense acidity enhance the texture. Spiced apple and a touch of toast add complexity. Drink now.
designation: La Pimpante Blanc de Blancs Fûts Brut

title: Ben Haines 2015 Volta Brackets Marsanne (Yarra Valley)
description: Ben Haines's whites are all about texture, and this Yarra Valley Marsanne doesn't disappoint. It's mineral-driven and tightly wound. with aromas of honeysuckle, pear, green apple rind and crushed stone that flow seamlessly onto a palate that's citrusy and chalky. A backbone of bright, focused acidity makes this exceptionally food friendly.

title: Bertrand-Delespierre NV Enfant de la Montagne Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: The nonvintage cuvée from this producer, this reveals great finesse. Minerality and tight acidity are balanced by the elegant white fruit and acidity. Everything is just right, giving a crisp wine that is ready to drink.
designation: Enfant de la Montagne Premier Cru Brut

title: Bethel Heights 2016 West Block Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: The West block vines date to 1977 and reveal complex flavors of pomegranate and raspberry fruit, layered with chocolate and coconut streaks. It's balanced and persistent, drinking nicely and set to age gracefully for a decade or longer.

title: Billecart-Salmon NV Brut Sous Bois  (Champagne)
description: Equal proportions of the three main Champagne grapes and partial aging in wood before bottling give this wine a distinctively rich character. Bottle aging has also softened the concentrated white fruits and acidity. This balanced wine is ready to drink.

title: Boizel NV Ultime Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This crisp wine balances dryness with its ripe fruit and strong mineral texture. It is rich while also so dry ,with almost no dosage. As such it needs to age a little longer, so drink this bottling from 2019.

title: Chehalem 2015 Ridgecrest Vineyards (Reserve) Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: This reserve-level wine, from the estate's Ribbon Ridge AVA vineyard, is concentrated and complicated. Aging in half new oak barrels piles on flavors of baking spices and toast, while the core of ripe cherry fruit is highlighted with streaks of cola, coffee and tobacco. It's drinking quite nicely and should continue to do so through 2025.

title: Deer Creek 2015 Private Reserve Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: The talented Herb Quady had a hand in making this wine, a delicious bottle jam-packed with flavors of blueberry compote and blueberry cobbler. It's tasty, forward and set in a palate-pleasing toasty frame. Drink now–2023.

title: Domaine de la Gaverie 2017 Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)
description: Neither dry nor sweet, this wine is fruity, with a firm edge of minerality and a zesty character. It hovers between acidity, fresh fruit and a more honeyed character giving poise and some good aging potential. Drink this succulent wine from 2020.

title: Domaine Fouassier 2017 Clos Paradis  (Sancerre)
description: This rich wine has not lost its acidity or mineral-driven white fruits. With a touch of pepper on the palate from the alcohol, the wine is full, dense and will be better from 2019.

title: Domaine Laporte 2017 Les Grandmontains  (Sancerre)
description: With an edge of tangy fruit, this wine is ripe, concentrated and intensely textured. Its strong citrus fruits, great acidity, concentrated minerality and zesty freshness are still developing. It needs time to round out and become even richer. Drink from 2020.

title: Elyse 2015 York Creek Vineyard Petite Sirah (Spring Mountain District)
description: Huge in tannin structure, this mountain-grown wine includes 7% Carignan and 2% Zinfandel. Baked bread, red fruit, leather and sizable brawn characterize its youthfulness; enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Encosta do Sobral 2015 Different Red (Tejo)
description: A powerful wine, an iron fist in a velvet glove, this wine is rich and dense, hiding its tannic concentration with a smooth generous texture. Acidity, ripe black fruits and layers of acidity and dryness all suggest that the wine should age further. Drink from 2019.

title: Franz Keller 2017 Vom Löss Pinot Gris (Baden)
description: Sugar cookie and lemon aromas perfume this elegantly structured Pinot Gris. It's medium bodied and dry, with concentrated grapefruit and lemon flavors that leave a pleasant murmur of citrus zest on midpalate. It finishes on lingering notes of crushed mineral and volcanic ash.

title: Fullerton 2016 Fir Crest Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This mix of clone 115 and Pommard is principally sourced for vines more than three decades old. It's firmly anchored in dark flavors of black cherry, cassis, baker's chocolate and espresso. Tannins are ripe and firm, while the finish carries a light suggestion of charred wood.
